definition: competitive/eagerly/to vie
to compete/to contend/to struggle
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: The island chiefs had competed to erect ever bigger statues.
sentences.chinese: 复活节岛的领主们竞相修建更大的石像。

sentences.english: Birds compete for food with squirrels.
But its customers are resiliently campaigning to rescue and protect the Coffee House.
sentences.chinese: 但其客户竞相救助和保护咖啡屋。

sentences.english: The the thrushes they were warbling , The violets they were charming.
sentences.chinese: 画眉鸟柔和的唱着歌，还有那娇媚的紫罗兰竞相开放。

sentences.english: Threadless encourages people to compete to design T-shirts.
sentences.chinese: 无线T恤公司鼓励人们竞相去设计T恤。

sentences.english: The bleak winter was over, flowers are in full blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

sentences.english: The network game was recent years each big business competes the excavation the buried treasure.
sentences.chinese: 网络游戏是近年来各大商家竞相发掘的宝藏。

sentences.english: However, this approach can back fire if it triggers a price-cutting spiral.
sentences.chinese: 然而事与愿违的是，这条途径可能引发商家竞相降价。

sentences.english: The papers have all been trying to second-guess each other about the President's next move.
sentences.chinese: 各报一直在竞相猜测总统的下一步行动。

sentences.english: At least 20 countries and many companies raced to investigate the idea.
sentences.chinese: 至少20个国家还有许多公司竞相研究这个想法。

sentences.english: Two guys tried to beat each other's time around the woman.
sentences.chinese: 有两个家伙围绕着这个女人竞相角逐，争风吃醋。

sentences.english: The banks fell over each other to lend money as they jostled for market share.
sentences.chinese: 银行竞相追求市场份额，于是争先发放贷款。

sentences.english: All kinds of flowers have come out in the valley.
sentences.chinese: 山谷里各种各样的花已竞相开放。

sentences.english: The aim was to prevent a return to the competitive devaluations best illustrated by the "butter wars."
sentences.chinese: 其目标是防止货币竞相贬值的局面重演。

sentences.english: The anti-Japanese war culture is precious tourism resources, which has been competitively developed in all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 抗战文化是珍贵的旅游资源，全国各地竞相开发。

sentences.english: The biting winter is gone and the flowers come into blossom.
sentences.chinese: 寒风刺骨的冬天已经过去，鲜花正竞相开放。

definition: to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
to compete to be first/to contest first place
to come thick and fast (idiom)
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
index (loanword)
contending for supreme beauty (esp. of flowers, scenery, painting etc)/vying in beauty and glamor
to compete/to fight for/to rush to purchase
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
vying to be the most glamorous/each more gorgeous than the other/beauty contest
numerous
to copy/to imitate
see 仿傚|仿效[fang3 xiao4]
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
competition/to compete/to pursue
most outstanding/par excellence
